results.title: The Spoilers
results.brief_description: Designed as a training film for employees of supermarkets to acquaint them with the dangers of poor sanitation practices. It furnishes fundamental knowledge of basic bacteriology in terms of bacteria, how they multiply and under what conditions, and dramatically points out the dangers microbes hold for human beings.

results.title: The Splendour falls: the first conquerors
results.creator_credit: John Mead and HTV Cymru, Wales
results.brief_description: The story of 500 years of castles in Wales - the most castled part of Britain. From earth fortification, scientific Roman forts, the Dark Ages, King Arthur to the true castlemakers, the Norman invaders who began with “wooden” castles. Includes animation, prints, engravings and tapestries. Narrated and written by Wynford Vaughan-Thomas.

results.title: The Splendour and the Peaks
results.creator_credit: Jack Rogers, Eric Thompson, Tasmanian Government Film Unit, Australian Commonwealth Film Unit and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: The Freycinet and Mount Field National Parks in Tasmania. Family parties and bushwalkers visit the Freycinet Peninsular where the red granite peaks of the Hazards dominate the sheltered waters of Coles Bay. From the summit of the highest peak, Mt Amos, there is a magnificent view of Wineglass Bay. At Mt Field we find the Russell Falls, Lake Dobson, Lake Seal, the towering dolerite columns of the watcher, and beautiful trees, birds and mosses to delight the visitor.

results.title: The Spirit of the beehive = El Espiritu de la colmena
results.creator_credit: Victor Erice, Elias Querejeta and Elias Querejeta Producciones
results.brief_description: This hauntingly atmospheric mood piece is set in rural Spain soon after the Civil War. In the oppressive postwar atmosphere there is an unbridgeable gulf between the parents and children of the household. The parents have retreated into private worlds - beekeeping and an obsession with a ‘lost’ child. After seeing James Whale’s ‘Frankenstein’ at a travelling film show the children conjure the monster up as a playmate. In the mind of the imaginative and impressionable Ana the figure of a fugitive soldier fuses with the figure of the monster. Cast includes Fernando Fernan Gomez, Teresa Gimpera, Ana Torrent, Isabel Telleria. In Spanish with English subtitles.

results.title: The Spirit of physical education
results.creator_credit: John Kingsford-Smith, Department of Education of NSW and Kingcroft Productions
results.brief_description: The new syllabus in physical education introduced by the New South Wales Department of Education was enthusiastically adopted by teachers in primary schools. In this film, groups of school boys and girls demonstrate a variety of group exercises and show how they enjoy this new approach to physical education. The film emphasises the value of such group activity in building character and self-confidence, in developing healthy social attitudes and in providing healthy physical exercise.

results.title: The Spirit moves: jazz dance from turn of the century 'til 1950
results.creator_credit: Mura Dehn and Dehn and Matter
results.brief_description: Filmed over 30 years in the director’s dance studio and in the Harlem Savoy Ballroom “The Spirit Moves” is a unique assembly of jazz routines, through the development of the art. From ragtime, struts, cakewalk, through blues, bebop to calypso, mambo and rock and roll. Performed by the artists of the Savioy Ballroom of Harlem and narrated by Mura Dehn. Filmed in black and white with final 15 minute segment in colour.

results.title: The Spiral Staircase
results.creator_credit: Robert Siodmak, Dore Schary and RKO Radio Pictures
results.brief_description: The spiral staircase is a thriller with chilling developments. It set a standard by which other classic thrillers may be judged. A small town in 1906 New England is terrorised by a psychopathic killer of deformed girls. Based on the novel “Some must watch” by Ethel Lina White. Stars Dorothy McGuire, George Brent, Kent Smith and Ethel Barrymore.

results.title: The Spiny Ant-eater
results.creator_credit: Arthur Hansen and Australian Instructional Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 4 of Series “Wild Life”.
Sequence of shots of the Spiny Ant-Easter digging into the ground. The differences between it and European porcupines are explained as well as the unique characteristics of this strange Australian mammal.
